attack_level.definition: A property of a strike (typically 0-4) that determines the duration of hitstun, blockstun, and hitstop. Higher levels generally result in more advantage for the attacker.

scale.description: Low stun, typical for light punches.
Medium stun, typical for kicks and some slashes.
High stun, typical for heavy slashes.
Highest stun, typical for powerful specials or charged normals.

counter_hit.definition: Occurs when an attack connects during the startup or active frames of an opponent's attack.

standard_ch.name: Standard Counter Hit
standard_ch.description: A regular counter hit with standard damage and hitstun bonuses.

risc_ch.name: R.I.S.C. Counter Hit
risc_ch.condition: Occurs when an attack hits an opponent with a full R.I.S.C. Gauge.
risc_ch.effect: Triggers the strongest possible Counter Hit state and deals an additional 10% damage on top of the standard CH bonus.
